meanings.definition: To talk more than someone else in a conversation or discussion.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, Sarah outtalked everyone with her detailed explanations.
meanings.sent2: She always outtalked her friends when they gathered to chat.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Tom outtalked the chatterbox, leaving everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm outtalked any doubts that lingered in the room.
meanings.sent5: The professor's lecture outtalked any other presentation I had ever seen.

meanings.definition: To surpass in talking or conversation.
meanings.sent1: In debates, he consistently outtalked his opponents with logical arguments.
meanings.sent2: The radio host outtalked all other broadcasters with his engaging interviews.
meanings.sent3: The parrot outtalked the other birds in the aviary, much to their annoyance.
meanings.sent4: Her eloquence outtalked any previous speaker at the event.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech outtalked any other campaign message in recent memory.
